item.title: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP)
item.description: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: - Add an external Identity Provider: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/identity-providers/ Structure type: Navigation Content type: Dynamic Index A dynamic index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: Define your own scopes, claims, and access policies
item.description: Define your own scopes, claims, and access policies with a custom authorization server Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: @Dan Maharry - After our conversation, I lookedup the actual definition for “Identity Federation” and I can see how it relates to Authorization server. Definition: “Identity federation isÂ a system of trust between two parties for the purpose of authenticating users and conveying information needed to authorize their access to resources.

item.title: Store your users across multiple tenants
item.description: Store your users across multiple tenants Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: Update title Links to original docs: - Multi-tenant solutions: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/multi-tenancy/ Why is this here?: - 14% of respondents placed Hub and Spoke, which is a multitenant configuraiton under “Federate Identities” It was the second largest group. “Deploy” was number one, although I don’t think “Deploy” is a good fit for this topic
